title: What are Peter Parker’s webs made out of? - Quora

response.answer_text: Actual spider silk comes in several types, usually a type of substance called “block co-polymer” in which some simple chemical formulas are repeated to form a long thread. Spider-Man originally invented a “web fluid” and spray devices on his wrists to release it as threads with various useful characteristics. But for a while, he was mutated and grew web glands inside his wrists. Not coincidentally, one film version of Spider-Man has that. Oh, and his black costume is actually an alien called a Klyntar which also produced the thread from its body.
